hypothesis_content.title: Regime Transition Momentum Fade on Failed Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC attempts a regime transition from NEUTRAL to BULL but fails to sustain momentum above the 20-day ATR-adjusted breakout threshold for 3 consecutive days, a mean-reversion move back into NEUTRAL/BEAR territory occurs within 5 trading days with 70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakouts in neutral regimes often trap momentum traders. Low-volume breakouts with overbought RSI suggest weak institutional participation. The market tends to revert to mean when genuine regime transitions lack confirmation.
entry_conditions: BTC daily close > (20-day SMA + 1.5 * 20-day ATR) for 1 day
Next day fails to close above same threshold
Volume on breakout day < 1.2x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC closes > (20-day SMA + 2.0 * 20-day ATR) for 2 consecutive days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such failed breakout patterns successfully transition to BULL regime within 5 days when tested on 2021-2024 BTC daily data.
